channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: XEngine: Optimal Tensor Rematerialization for Neural Networks in Heterogeneous Environments
item.description: For this, we formulate a mixed-integer quadratic program (MIQP) to schedule operators of deep learning networks on heterogeneous systems.

item.title: Learning from Training Dynamics: Identifying Mislabeled Data Beyond Manually Designed Features
item.description: While mislabeled or ambiguously-labeled samples in the training set could negatively affect the performance of deep models, diagnosing the dataset and identifying mislabeled samples helps to improve the generalization power.

item.title: Photo-Realistic Out-of-domain GAN inversion via Invertibility Decomposition
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel framework that enhances the fidelity of human face inversion by designing a new module to decompose the input images to ID and OOD partitions with invertibility masks.

item.title: Improving Pre-Trained Weights Through Meta-Heuristics Fine-Tuning
item.description: Machine Learning algorithms have been extensively researched throughout the last decade, leading to unprecedented advances in a broad range of applications, such as image classification and reconstruction, object recognition, and text categorization.

item.title: Visconde: Multi-document QA with GPT-3 and Neural Reranking
item.description: This paper proposes a question-answering system that can answer questions whose supporting evidence is spread over multiple (potentially long) documents.

item.title: Large Language Models are reasoners with Self-Verification
item.description: We propose a new method called self-verification that uses the conclusion of the CoT as a condition to build a new sample and asks the LLM to re-predict the original conditions which be masked.

item.title: Rethinking Label Smoothing on Multi-hop Question Answering
item.description: Label smoothing is a regularization technique widely used in supervised learning to improve the generalization of models on various tasks, such as image classification and machine translation.

item.title: Optimizing Prompts for Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Instead of laborious human engineering, we propose prompt adaptation, a general framework that automatically adapts original user input to model-preferred prompts.

item.title: Reference-based Image and Video Super-Resolution via C2-Matching
item.description: To tackle these challenges, we propose C2-Matching in this work, which performs explicit robust matching crossing transformation and resolution.

item.title: Answering Complex Logical Queries on Knowledge Graphs via Query Tree Optimization
item.description: In this work, we propose QTO (Query Tree Optimization) that can efficiently find the exact optimal solution.

item.title: Position-guided Text Prompt for Vision-Language Pre-training
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel Position-guided Text Prompt (PTP) paradigm to enhance the visual grounding ability of cross-modal models trained with VLP.

item.title: Cognitive Accident Prediction in Driving Scenes: A Multimodality Benchmark
item.description: In particular, the text description provides a dense semantic description guidance for the primary context of the traffic scene, while the driver attention provides a traction to focus on the critical region closely correlating with safe driving.

item.title: Query-as-context Pre-training for Dense Passage Retrieval
item.description: Query-as-context pre-training assumes that the predicted query is a special context for the document and uses contrastive learning or contextual masked auto-encoding learning to compress the document and query into dense vectors.

item.title: Latent Diffusion for Language Generation
item.description: Diffusion models have achieved great success in modeling continuous data modalities such as images, audio, and video, but have seen limited use in discrete domains such as language.

item.title: Randomized Quantization for Data Agnostic Representation Learning
item.description: Towards this end, masking has emerged as a generic and powerful tool where content is withheld along the sequential dimension, e. g., spatial in images, temporal in audio, and syntactic in language.

item.title: Emergent Analogical Reasoning in Large Language Models
item.description: The recent advent of large language models - large neural networks trained on a simple predictive objective over a massive corpus of natural language - has reinvigorated debate over whether human cognitive capacities might emerge in such generic models given sufficient training data.

item.title: Transferring General Multimodal Pretrained Models to Text Recognition
item.description: This paper proposes a new method, OFA-OCR, to transfer multimodal pretrained models to text recognition.

item.title: MM-Diffusion: Learning Multi-Modal Diffusion Models for Joint Audio and Video Generation
item.description: To generate joint audio-video pairs, we propose a novel Multi-Modal Diffusion model (i. e., MM-Diffusion), with two-coupled denoising autoencoders.

item.title: Million-scale Object Detection with Large Vision Model
item.description: Over the past few years, developing a broad, universal, and general-purpose computer vision system has become a hot topic.

item.title: Segmentation Ability Map: Interpret deep features for medical image segmentation
item.description: In addition, our method can provide a mean SA score which can give a performance estimation of the output on the test images without ground-truth.

item.title: Discovering Language Model Behaviors with Model-Written Evaluations
item.description: We also find some of the first examples of inverse scaling in RL from Human Feedback (RLHF), where more RLHF makes LMs worse.

item.title: BLOOM+1: Adding Language Support to BLOOM for Zero-Shot Prompting
item.description: The BLOOM model is a large open-source multilingual language model capable of zero-shot learning, but its pretraining was limited to 46 languages.

item.title: Solving QMLTP Problems by Translation to Higher-order Logic
item.description: This paper describes an evaluation of Automated Theorem Proving (ATP) systems on problems taken from the QMLTP library of first-order modal logic problems.

item.title: NusaCrowd: Open Source Initiative for Indonesian NLP Resources
item.description: We present NusaCrowd, a collaborative initiative to collect and unite existing resources for Indonesian languages, including opening access to previously non-public resources.

item.title: Learning Object-level Point Augmentor for Semi-supervised 3D Object Detection
item.description: In this work, we propose an object-level point augmentor (OPA) that performs local transformations for semi-supervised 3D object detection.

item.title: Marginal-Certainty-aware Fair Ranking Algorithm
item.description: In MCFair, we first develop a ranking objective that includes uncertainty, fairness, and user utility.

item.title: Contextually Enhanced ES-dRNN with Dynamic Attention for Short-Term Load Forecasting
item.description: These cells enable the model to capture short-term, long-term and seasonal dependencies across time series as well as to weight dynamically the input information.

item.title: Beyond Digital "Echo Chambers": The Role of Viewpoint Diversity in Political Discussion
item.description: We find that the diversity scores for both Fragmentation and Representation are lower for immigration than for DST.

item.title: Don't Forget Your ABC's: Evaluating the State-of-the-Art in Chat-Oriented Dialogue Systems
item.description: There has been great recent advancement in human-computer chat.

item.title: SUCRe: Leveraging Scene Structure for Underwater Color Restoration
item.description: By following points in multiple images and tracking their intensities at different distances to the sensor we constrain the optimization of the image formation model parameters.

item.title: JEMMA: An Extensible Java Dataset for ML4Code Applications
item.description: To demonstrate the utility of the dataset, we also report results from two empirical studies on our data, ultimately showing that significant work lies ahead in the design of context-aware source code models that can reason over a broader network of source code entities in a software project, the very task that JEMMA is designed to help with.

item.title: A Better Choice: Entire-space Datasets for Aspect Sentiment Triplet Extraction
item.description: Aspect sentiment triplet extraction (ASTE) aims to extract aspect term, sentiment and opinion term triplets from sentences.

item.title: Text2Struct: A Machine Learning Pipeline for Mining Structured Data from Text
item.description: Many analysis and prediction tasks require the extraction of structured data from unstructured texts.

item.title: Predicting Citi Bike Demand Evolution Using Dynamic Graphs
item.description: In this paper, we attempt to apply a graph neural network model to predict bike demand in the New York City, Citi Bike dataset.

item.title: Style-Hallucinated Dual Consistency Learning: A Unified Framework for Visual Domain Generalization
item.description: Furthermore, we present a novel style hallucination module (SHM) to generate style-diversified samples that are essential to consistency learning.

item.title: Recall, Expand and Multi-Candidate Cross-Encode: Fast and Accurate Ultra-Fine Entity Typing
item.description: We also found MCCE is very effective in fine-grained (130 types) and coarse-grained (9 types) entity typing.

item.title: MeSH Suggester: A Library and System for MeSH Term Suggestion for Systematic Review Boolean Query Construction
item.description: One challenge to creating an effective systematic review Boolean query is the selection of effective MeSH Terms to include in the query.

item.title: Adaptive Uncertainty Distribution in Deep Learning for Unsupervised Underwater Image Enhancement
item.description: This makes it difficult to train supervised deep learning models on large and diverse datasets, which can limit the model's performance.

item.title: Rethinking the Role of Scale for In-Context Learning: An Interpretability-based Case Study at 66 Billion Scale
item.description: Using a 66 billion parameter language model (OPT-66B) across a diverse set of 14 downstream tasks, we find this is indeed the case: $\sim$70% of attention heads and $\sim$20% of feed forward networks can be removed with minimal decline in task performance.

item.title: Masked Wavelet Representation for Compact Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: There have been recent studies on how to reduce these computational inefficiencies by using additional data structures, such as grids or trees.

item.title: Confidence-aware Training of Smoothed Classifiers for Certified Robustness
item.description: Under the smoothed classifiers, the fundamental trade-off between accuracy and (adversarial) robustness has been well evidenced in the literature: i. e., increasing the robustness of a classifier for an input can be at the expense of decreased accuracy for some other inputs.

item.title: BEATs: Audio Pre-Training with Acoustic Tokenizers
item.description: In the first iteration, we use random projection as the acoustic tokenizer to train an audio SSL model in a mask and label prediction manner.

item.title: Training Robots to Evaluate Robots: Example-Based Interactive Reward Functions for Policy Learning
item.description: Physical interactions can often help reveal information that is not readily apparent.

item.title: Flattening-Net: Deep Regular 2D Representation for 3D Point Cloud Analysis
item.description: In this paper, we present an unsupervised deep neural architecture called Flattening-Net to represent irregular 3D point clouds of arbitrary geometry and topology as a completely regular 2D point geometry image (PGI) structure, in which coordinates of spatial points are captured in colors of image pixels.

item.title: Accurate Open-set Recognition for Memory Workload
item.description: How can we accurately identify new memory workloads while classifying known memory workloads?

item.title: Are We Ready for Vision-Centric Driving Streaming Perception? The ASAP Benchmark
item.description: To mitigate the problem, we propose the Autonomous-driving StreAming Perception (ASAP) benchmark, which is the first benchmark to evaluate the online performance of vision-centric perception in autonomous driving.

item.title: Modeling Global Distribution for Federated Learning with Label Distribution Skew
item.description: It introduces a global Generative Adversarial Network to model the global data distribution without access to local datasets, so the global model can be trained using the global information of data distribution without privacy leakage.

item.title: Controlling Styles in Neural Machine Translation with Activation Prompt
item.description: First, we re-visit this task and propose a multiway stylized machine translation (MSMT) benchmark, which includes multiple categories of styles in four language directions to push the boundary of this task.

item.title: An Evolutionary Multitasking Algorithm with Multiple Filtering for High-Dimensional Feature Selection
item.description: Thus, this paper devises a new EMT algorithm for FS in high-dimensional classification, which first adopts different filtering methods to produce multiple tasks and then modifies a competitive swarm optimizer to efficiently solve these related tasks via knowledge transfer.

item.title: Trusting the Explainers: Teacher Validation of Explainable Artificial Intelligence for Course Design
item.description: Deep learning models for learning analytics have become increasingly popular over the last few years; however, these approaches are still not widely adopted in real-world settings, likely due to a lack of trust and transparency.
